intro: Bieneria, commonly known as the white sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to dry, well-drained environments. Bieneria is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
